title: Fix text clipping in “Why SweetSteps?” modal carousel by increasing selected container height

requirements.summary: Increase the rendered height of the specific selected carousel element on the Landing page “Why SweetSteps?” modal so slide text is not clipped, without affecting surrounding carousel styling.
acceptanceCriteria: When opening “Why SweetSteps?” on the Landing page and navigating through all carousel slides, no slide’s title or description text is visually clipped/cut off.
The selected element is visibly taller than before and provides enough vertical space for the longest description at common breakpoints (mobile and desktop).
No unexpected scrollbars appear inside the card/selected element as a result of the height change.
Carousel navigation (Previous/Next buttons, dot indicators, slide transitions) continues to work and looks unchanged aside from the increased height of the selected element.
Only the element corresponding to the provided XPath has its styling adjusted; other components and pages remain unchanged.

file_operations.description: Adjust only the carousel’s inner container div that matches the provided XPath (the element currently using Tailwind classes including "relative overflow-hidden min-h-[280px] md:min-h-[240px]") by increasing its Tailwind min-height values enough to prevent feature description clipping at mobile/desktop breakpoints, while keeping carousel behavior and surrounding layout unchanged.
